intro: Pseudocyclosorus, commonly known as the false water clover, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that often resemble those of water clover, though it is not closely related. These plants typically grow in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Pseudocyclosorus species are often found in nutrient-rich waters and can form dense mats on the water surface. They play a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small organisms and contributing to water filtration.
